means: 有节奏地舒张及收缩( pulsate的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: The music is pulsating and the atmosphere is intoxicating.
sentence.Network_cn: 音乐在有节奏地响着，气氛令人陶醉。

sentence.Network_en: Lights were pulsating in the sky.
It was a pulsating session in which a member of the audience shouted "Judas" at Dylan for deserting his folk roots.
sentence.Network_cn: 这场演出气氛紧张，观众中有人朝着迪伦大叫“犹大”，指责他抛弃了他的民歌根基。

entry.def: If something pulsates, it beats, moves in and out, or shakes with strong, regular movements.

means.word_mean: 1. expanding and contracting rhythmically as to the beating of the heart;

auth_sentence.content: Un Dia is a pulsating, warm-sounding piece of relatively lo-fi indie electronica.
